text:
This is the most incredible way to kick off the 
new year in style. It's a roast pork recipe. Elegant

slices of succulent pork, outrageous crackling 
and the most amazing sweet leek beans. This one

you'll love. We've got a beautiful free-range 
pork loin. Before we start cooking the pork we

need to prepare the trivet and for 
that we need these beautiful leeks.

So the only other buddy for mr leek is garlic 
and that will go in whole skin on and all is

going to be amazing. So I'm going to make the 
most beautiful but simple marinade for the pork.

I'm going to use marjoram which is a 
beautiful herb, add a pinch of sea salt

and just bash to a pulp and that is gonna flavour 
that incredible pork. To finish go in with two

tablespoons of olive oil and two of red wine 
vinegar. So I'm gonna remove this lovely skin.

Let's prepare this pork. I'm going to start 
doing little cuts using the length of the

knife about every half a centimetre. We're cutting 
through that fat and not cutting into the meat.

We'll turn it 90 degrees and score it 
exactly the same the other direction.

Basically what we've created is the most amazing 
fat checkerboard which that marinade is going to

cling onto. So get half of that lovely marinade and 
then at this point we can just open up all those

cracks and rub it in, it's going to be amazing. 
Put the skin on a tray then oil and salt it.

Create a snug fit on the trivet and 
whack it in the oven on full blast.

As soon as I close the door i'm going to turn 
this down to 200 degrees celsius and it needs an

hour and 20 minutes. Now I want to show you how to 
make the best greens ever. We've got some spinach,

avoid cabbage, some cavallo nero. Boil the veg in 
salted boiling water, starting from the toughest

leaves to the thinnest. Then leave them to cool 
quickly before simply wilting the spinach with

some of the cooking water. Then just gather up 
the four corners of this tea towel like that and

squeeze. Now in here we've got pure, unadulterated, 
dense, vibrant greens. I'm just going to slice it

up kind of fine, that is going to be incredible. 
With the veggies done it's time to check the pork.

It smells absolutely amazing. Look at that! 
And then we've got our lovely crackling here.

We have to let this rest for at least half an hour 
right, we want all the lovely juices to go back

to where they should be. Put crackling over 
here and let's talk about what's in this pan

here. Just pull out the whole garlic bulb. I want 
you to use a fork just to kind of squeeze that

lovely creamy inside out. So then just mash it up, 
sweep it up and this is like culinary gold dust.

This is where the fun starts lovely people. We're 
swapping out our good old roasties for a mix

of beautiful beans and pulses. I'm using butter 
beans, chickpeas and cannellini beans and they're

just going to take in all of those flavours. Then a 
little bit of creme fresh. So I'm going to turn

this down to low now and let that just tick away 
while that meat rests and then I'll serve it up.

Look at this! Using a nice long carving knife 
and what you're going to notice from this is A-

it's still steaming. B- can you see how juicy that 
is? That ain't no dry pork. Oh this is gonna be

a roast pork dinner like you've never had 
before, time to plate up! That is the basis

of the dish, then with some of those amazing greens, 
take our pork and just lay it perfectly over the

top like that, come on! And just kind of put little 
bits little splinters of that crunchy crackling

around the outside, look at that, and then don't 
forget we've got that amazing marinade sauce

and all you need is a little teaspoon of 
that stuff, gonna be a mouthful of heaven.

What a great way to kick off the new year 
in style. There you go, pork, beans, greens...

crunch of crackling and the utter sort of 
indulgence and silk of the beans is amazing.

The pork is juicy and that little bit of 
perfectly cooked greens just lifts the whole thing.

Have a go at that. That's roast pork 
but not as you know it. Happy new year.
